summary: The Mitigating Automated Internet Networks for Event Ticketing Act (MAIN Event Ticketing Act) aims to strengthen the Better Online Ticket Sales (BOTS) Act of 2016. It focuses on preventing the use of automated bots to purchase event tickets, mandating that online ticket issuers implement security measures, report circumvention incidents, and address causes of circumvention. The bill also includes provisions for FTC guidance, civil penalties for violations, law enforcement coordination, and a congressional report on enforcement actions. It updates and clarifies definitions relating to circumvention and adds more consumer protection measures for online ticket purchases.
